error.signature: Error: Invalid for_each argument: The "for_each" set includes values derived from resource attributes that cannot be determined until apply
error.regex: (Invalid for_each argument|for_each .+ cannot be determined until apply|for_each .+ depends on .+ unknown|for_each .+ set includes values .+ resource attributes)

verdict.summary: The for_each argument depends on values not known until apply, which Terraform requires at plan time.

dead_ends.action: Convert for_each to count to solve the issue
dead_ends.why_fails: count has the same restriction on unknown values and switching between count and for_each forces resource recreation

dead_ends.action: Use depends_on to ensure the for_each source is computed first
dead_ends.why_fails: depends_on controls execution order but does not make unknown values known at plan time

workarounds.action: Use input variables or data sources instead of computed resource attributes for the for_each key set
workarounds.how: Replace for_each = resource.x.ids with for_each = var.known_ids or for_each = toset(data.source.ids)

workarounds.action: Use a two-stage apply with remote state to pass computed values
workarounds.how: First config outputs the computed set, second config reads it via terraform_remote_state data source

leads_to.condition: Switching to count encounters similar unknown value restrictions

preceded_by.condition: After handling sensitive for_each values, unknown value issues surface

frequently_confused_with.distinction: for_each sensitive is about sensitive values in the set; for_each error is about unknown/computed values at plan time
